newsitem.title: USA: Basketball player Camby arrested on marijuana charge.
newsitem.headline: Basketball player Camby arrested on marijuana charge.

text.p: Basketball player Marcus Camby, 23, was arrested on a marijuana charge and released on bond early Friday, police said.
Camby, a centre for the Toronto Raptors of the National Basketball Association (NBA), was released on a $1,000 bond and faces a June 25 court appearance in Manchester, Conn., said Sgt. Matthew Reed.

He was charged with possession of less than four ounces of marijuana and failure to drive in the proper lane. If convicted, he faces a maximum penalty of one year in jail and a possible fine of $2,000, Reed said.
Camby was driving a rented car at around 2 a.m. when a police officer noticed it was weaving slightly, Reed said. "As the officer spoke with Camby, he noticed the smell of burned marijuana," he said.
Police then discovered two marijuana cigarette ends in the ashtray and an unlighted marijuana cigarette.
Reed said Camby did not act impaired at the time of arrest. "There was no evidence of intoxication by alcohol or drugs," he said. "The officer felt comfortable not making him take a sobriety test."
Camby, a Hartford native, was a college basketball standout at the University of Massachusetts. He lives in South Windsor, Conn.
